output_json.draft_response:
Below is a safe-practice guide you can use when you receive a message like the one shown. Instead of replying to the sender (which can confirm that your address is active and may lead to more unwanted mail), follow these steps:

| Step | What to Do | Why It Helps |
|------|------------|--------------|
| 1 | Do not click any links | Prevents you from visiting a malicious site |
| 2 | Mark as Spam/Phishing | Helps your provider improve filters |
| 3 | Delete the email | Removes the threat from your inbox |
| 4 | Verify your account security | Change passwords / enable 2FA |
| 5 | Educate yourself & others | Share signs of phishing attempts |
| 6 | Report to relevant authorities (optional) | Helps organizations take action |

Quick note to team: This is a classic phishing attempt. Do not click links. Report and delete.
